section: Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider.
explanation: This section mandates that Provider Representatives be exclusively dedicated to the Recipient. This could be a contradiction if Exhibit A lists Provider Representatives who are known to be working for other clients of the Provider, or if the scope of Services in Exhibit A implicitly requires the Provider Representatives to utilize resources or knowledge gained from other clients.

section: Recipient shall own, and Provider hereby irrevocably assigns to the Recipient, all rights, title, and interest in any invention, technique, process, device, discovery, improvement, or know-how, whether patentable or not and all other proprietary rights, industrial rights and any other similar rights, in each case on a worldwide basis, and all copies and tangible embodiments thereof, or any part thereof, in whatever form or medium hereafter made or conceived solely or jointly by Provider while working for or on behalf of the Recipient, which relate to, is suggested by, or results from the Services.
explanation: This is a broad assignment of intellectual property rights. It could contradict standard intellectual property law in some jurisdictions if the Provider independently develops something that only tangentially relates to the Services, especially if it is not based on Recipient's Confidential Information. The phrase 'suggested by' is particularly broad and could be challenged.

section: As consideration for provision of the Services following the Effective Date, Recipient shall pay Provider an amount equal to Provider's actual cost of providing the Services plus a 10% service fee. In addition to such amount, in the event that Provider incurs reasonable and documented out-of-pocket expenses in the provision of any Service, including, without limitation, license fees and payments to third-party service providers or subcontractors (such included expenses, collectively, "Out-of-Pocket Costs"), Recipient shall reimburse Provider for all such Out-of-Pocket Costs.
explanation: This section defines the payment terms as Provider's actual cost plus a 10% service fee, and reimbursement for Out-of-Pocket Costs. This payment structure could be problematic if 'actual cost' is not clearly defined, leading to disputes. Furthermore, the definition of 'Out-of-Pocket Costs,' while including examples, might not be exhaustive, leading to disagreements over what qualifies for reimbursement.
